title.rendered: 7 Ways To Be A Good Roommate

content.rendered:
We are always on the hunt for good roommates but have you ever stopped to ask yourself if you’re a nice roommate yourself? And often times, as human nature would have it, we hold others to high, sometimes unattainable standards. Before seeking out the world’s coolest and most compatible person to share an apartment with – become one. So here’s your guide on how to be a good roommate.

1. A good roommate should be considerate of shared space.

There is no crime in being a naturally messy person. But keep the controlled chaos in your room, where no one can tell you what’s what. In shared space like the kitchen, living room, bathroom, pretty much everywhere outside your bedroom, you have to think of others and maintain cleanliness to be a good roommate.

So you need to be considerate of shared space and the amount of it you consume. If you love decorating the living area with vintage lamps, be sure to ask your roommates if they wanted to add their own flair of creativity. This goes for dishes and other furniture you may bring into the shared space.

2. A good roommate is always on time.

Be a nice roommate by being on time with rent, utilities, and house meetings. Roommates usually have busy and varying schedules, so do your part in being prompt to be the good roommate you are.

3. Help when you can.

Spot a granola bar or two, a ride to campus, or just some life advice, help your roommates when you can. Additionally, the favor will likely be returned to you if you’re a good roommate to others.

4. Follow your contract to be a good roommate.

The most important rule to be a good roommate is to abide by the agreement. Especially if you gave the most input in creating it, it’s wise to refer to your house rules before you decide to have your boyfriend over for a week. So if you need an exception to any house rules always ask formally. Do not run it by your roommates as if they don’t have a say, because they do.

5. Keep roommates informed of schedule changes and vacation plans.

Keeping roommates in the loop is the best way to be a good roommate. Let each other know if you’re going out of town, they’ve been waiting for a good time to bring their parents up so while you’re gone is ideal. Plans are often made around each other’s coming and going so keeping a posted schedule on the fridge with marked changes is the best way to stay informed.

6. Have contact information.

This includes general cell phone number and email along with emergency contacts. It’s important to know who to contact in case of an emergency. And a good roommate can be an ideal choice.

7. Be open.

The best thing to do, even if you fail at all the rest, is to be an open minded roommate. So remember to not suffocate others in their own home, embrace different personalities and lifestyles. If you don’t already consider yourself open minded, being a good roommate is a great first step in the right direction.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers become a good roommate? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match! Download the app here and hop on the easiest ride home, ever!
